{{Infobox comedian | name = Costaki Economopoulous | image = | imagesize = | caption = | pseudonym = "The Biggest Name in Comedy" | birth_name = Constantinos Christos Vassilis Economopoulos | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1969|12|25}} | birth_place = [[Fort Lauderdale, Florida]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | medium = [[Political satire]] | nationality = [[United States|American]] | active = | genre = | subject = | influences = | influenced = | spouse = {{marriage|Christa Meola|2013}} | domesticpartner = [[Caroline Rhea]] <small>(2007â€“2010)</small> | children = 1 | notable_work = ''[[The Bob & Tom Show]]'' regular | signature = | website = {{URL|http://www.costaki.com}} | footnotes = | current_members = | past_members = }}
'''Constantinos Christos Vassilis "Costaki" Economopoulos''' (born December 25, 1969) is an [[United States|American]] [[Stand-up comedy|stand-up comedian]]. A [[Florida]] native, he grew up in [[Kennesaw, Georgia]]<ref>"Violent Culture" on his album ''C'mon It's Jokes''</ref> with his brother Andreas. He began his comedy career in 1993 while attending [[graduate school]] at the [[University of Georgia]]. Economopoulos covers several topics in his act, but focuses mainly on [[Political satire|political comedy]]. He is a regular guest on ''[[The Bob & Tom Show]]'', most notably with his former weekly broadcasts of a spot dubbed "The Economonologue".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bobandtom.com/gen3/ed_pages/index.htm |title=''The Bob & Tom Show'' 2008 program notes |accessdate=2008-08-07}}</ref> He has been billed as "the biggest name in comedy" in reference to his long name.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.postbulletin.com/entertainment/goonie-s-books-biggest-name-yet/article_210a1bc8-997d-51f6-a105-8f2e9e221574.html |title=Goonie's books biggest name yet |author=Sue Flemke |publisher=''[[Rochester Post-Bulletin]]'' |date=2015-03-06 |accessdate=2015-03-06}}</ref>
==Notable works== '''''C'Mon Its Jokes''''' is a CD of Costaki Economopoulos's stand-up routine.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.theseriouscomedysite.com/showreview.php?r_id=83 |title=theseriouscomedysite.com comedy review |author=Richard Lanoie |accessdate=2008-08-07}}</ref>
He also performs a weekly segment parodying the [[National Football League]] called Quick Snaps on ''[[Randy Baumann]] and [[the DVE Morning Show]]''. It airs on [[WDVE]], 102.5 FM in [[Pittsburgh]].
==Personal life== Costaki Economopoulos and his former partner, comedian [[Caroline Rhea]], have a daughter, Ava Rhea Economopoulos, born October 21, 2008.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv/2008/07/20/2008-07-20_caroline_rhea_messes_with_texas_in_the_u.html |title=Caroline Rhea messes with Texas in the uninhibited 'Sordid Lives' |author=Patrick Huguenin |publisher=''[[New York Daily News]]'' |date=2008-07-19 |accessdate=2008-08-07}}</ref> His current partner is photographer and teacher Christa Meola. They married in December 2013.<ref>{{cite book|last=Meola|first=Christa|title=The Art of Boudoir Photography|year=2013}}</ref> On 14th July 2018 they had a little girl Zoe.
